titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the James Henry Hewett Letters, 1861-1862
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, November 2021

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Letters, written on pictorial stationery, from Hewett to his brother, describing his movements through North Carolina and Virginia. He was located in Wilmington, N.C. (1861), Acquia Creek, Va. (1861-1862), Goldsboro, N.C. (1862), and Richmond, Va. (1862). One letter includes a description of General Thomas Jonathan ("Stonewall") Jackson.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: James Henry Hewett letters, 1861-1862, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, November 2021.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: James Henry Hewett was a Confederate soldier with Co. F, 3rd Regiment, North Carolina State Troops, from New Hanover County, North Carolina.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Letters, written on pictorial stationery, from Hewett to his brother, describing his movements through North Carolina and Virginia. He was located in Wilmington, N.C. (1861), Acquia Creek, Va. (1861-1862), Goldsboro, N.C. (1862), and Richmond, Va. (1862). One letter includes a description of General Thomas Jonathan ("Stonewall") Jackson.

controlaccess.corpname: Confederate States of America. Army. North Carolina Infantry Regiment, 3rd. Company F.
